*cold open*
Int. shot, some sort of stadium with a crowd. The viewer can clearly see that the crowd is mostly bored and many of them leave as Beyonce or some other overhyped and unloved musician leaves the stage.
HILLARY CLINTON: "The worst thing that can happen in a democracy - as well as in an individual's life - is to become cynical about the future and lose hope."
CROWD: moderate, half-hearted clapping. make most of them clap with one hand
BLACK SCREEN. TITLE GAG: *"Donald wins the election"*
Cue theme music.
INT SHOT: The oval office. It's not immediately clear because the camera is zoomed in on a tweet from Hillary Clinton, but it zooms out to show Donald Trump's extraordinarily small hands. The tweet says:
HILLARY CLINTON: I stand with the people gathered across the country tonight defending our values our Constitution. This is not who we are.
*Camera switches to view Donald's face. His brow is furrowed in concentration*
Enter STEVE BANNON and REINCE PRIEBUS, walking and talking
STEVE: All I'm saying is, that German guy with the moustache had some good ideas.
REINCE: You mean Angela Merkel?
STEVE: No, the other one. From the 30s.
DONALD: Can anyone tell me what the hell this says? Constipation? Did I almost lose to an incontinent?
STEVE: What?
REINCE: He can't read.
STEVE: You never learned to read? How did you graduate from Wharton Business School without learning to read?
DONALD: I'm a white, straight dude. They just handed out diplomas to us back then.
REINCE: He just reads the first letter of each word and assumes what they mean. Trust me, nobody understands the subtleties of Donald's retardation more than me.
DONALD: Alright, alright, look, where's that Executive Order I signed? Keeping all the Moslems out?
STEVE: You mean this one?
STEVE pulls out a seemingly-discarded napkin. It has stains on it, and some incomprehensible symbols.
STEVE: Donald, let me read this to you and see if it makes sense to you.
DONALD: Alright, okay.
STEVE: Hello, fellow American. No more... bomb... not even the word, a drawing of a bomb. No more bomb person in the University Statues of... I leave power. Good. Thank you. Crime, they'll be lower... son. This, is this a stain? What were you eating, chili?
REINCE: Hey, don't throw that out, that's perfectly good chili.
STEVE: This doesn't make any sense!
DONALD: Look, it's, kind of symbolic, you know? But fine, write it yourself, say whatever you want, just put my name on it.
STEVE: What degree did they give you at Wharton? I can't imagine -
DONALD: Bird Law. Look, it's complicated, alright? Bird law in this country -
Enter IVANKA, yelling over everyone.
IVANKA: Hey dickweeds, guess what?
EVERYBODY ignores her. They stop arguing, staring at her.
IVANKA: Nordstrom stopped selling my clothes!
EVERYBODY continues to stare at her. Awkward silence ensues.
REINCE: Is that uh -
IVANKA: Guys, come on, this is big news.
REINCE: No, but uh, is that, are we supposed to care?
STEVE: Yeah, uh, we're a little busy, with other things...
DONALD: Bird law, and banning the browns.
IVANKA: Oh really? That's more important than my clothes?
EVERYBODY, in unison: YES.
IVANKA: I guess I'll be dealing with this myself then.
STEVE: Have fun, now back to the important business... I had an idea about how to get Russia to love us. Two words: Dick towels.
*commercial break*
Keep tuned for more of It's Always Sunny in Washington D.C.!

This shit gets me steamed. In my state we have a gradually increasing minimum wage that varies by region, but it will ultimately be $15 everywhere. You know who this hurts the most? The many charitable and social services programs who can't afford to pay their workers as a result. I've met with dozens of organizations that help foster parents, young underprivileged kids, cancer patients, and more and the biggest complaint from all of them is that they can't afford to pay their workers. Because guess what, they're non-profits. This hurts everyone *except big businesses* more.
Oh, and the best part is that all these groups want more government funding to cover their losses. Just another reason for the government to spend more damn money. Fuck the economically illiterate short-term thinkers who want to double the minimum wage.
